                             00000   246 COMON1 EQU   *                                                          00217021

                                     248 *                                      IDENTIFICATION PURPOSES ONLY     00231021
 000000 C9D2C6C3C2D3F5F1             249          DC    C'IKFCBL51'              X                               00238021

1         PHASE 5 - A BRIEF DESCRIPTION                                                                         PAGE    8
-  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                                       ASM 0201 11.03 02/14/15
0                                    253 *=1       PH5 C O N T R O L .                                           00266021
                                     254 *=3                                                                     00273021
                                     255 *TITLE 'PH5     '                                                       00280021
                                     256 *STATUS: CHANGE LEVEL 000                                               00287021
                                     257 *FUNCTION/OPERATION: OBTAIN IC TEXT FROM 'PH4     ' AND CONVERT IT      00294021
                                     258 *   A-TEXT ACCEPTABLE TO 'PH6     '.                                    00301021
                                     259 *            ORGANIZATION OF PHASE...                                   00308021
                                     260 *              PH5CTL PHASE 5 CONTROL. OBTAINS IC-TEXT AND PROCESSE     00315021
                                     261 *                     ALL BUT VERB-STRINGS WHICH ARE ROUTED TO PROP     00322021
                                     262 *                     VERB ANALYZERS.                                   00329021
                                     263 *              A-TEXT GENERATOR. HAS ENTRY POINTS FOR MOST MACHINE      00336021
                                     264 *                     INSTRUCTIONS AND BUILDS A-TEXT (PROCEDURE AND     00343021
                                     265 *                     OPTIMIZATION) BASED UPON VARIOUS PARAMETERS       00350021
                                     266 *                     PROVIDED IT BY THE CALLING ANALYZER OR SUBRTN     00357021
                                     267 *                     SUPPLEMENTAL TO THIS PORTION IS                   00364021
                                     268 *                     THE DIRECT-PROCEDURE-A-TEXT GENERATOR,            00371021
                                     269 *                     A SUBROUTINE.                                     00378021
                                     270 *              VERB-ANALYZERS. SEPERATE ANALYZERS OBTAIN STRINGS FO     00385021
                                     271 *                     THEIR PARTICULAR VERBS AND GENERATES A-TEXT       00392021
                                     272 *                     REPRESENTING OBJECT CODE FOR THE STATEMENT.       00399021
                                     273 *              SUBROUTINES. NUMEROUS SERVICE SUBROUTINES SUPPORT        00406021
                                     274 *                     ALL OTHER PARTS OF THE PHASE.                     00413021
                                     275 *              SUBSCRIPTS AND SUBSCRIPT REGISTER ALLOCATION ARE HAN     00420021
                                     276 *                     BY SEVERAL SUBROUTINES AND ANALYZERS.             00427021
                                     277 *              TAMER TABLE AND COMMON ARE COMMUNICATION REGIONS IN      00434021
                                     278 *                     MAIN-STORAGE THAT ARE USED FOR INTER-PHASE        00441021
                                     279 *                     INFORMATION-PASSING, AND ARE NOT PART OF PHAS     00448021
-
                                     281 *ENTRY POINTS:                                                          00462021
                                     282 *        'PH5     ' MAIN ENTRY POINT, CALLED BY 'PH0     '.             00469021
                                     283 *INPUT:              IC-TEXT   SYSUT2                                   00476021
                                     284 *                     COMMON    MAIN-STORAGE                            00483021
                                     285 *OUTPUT:             PROCEDURE A-TEXT   SYSUT1                          00490021
                                     286 *                     OPTIMIZATION A-TEXT SYSUT3                        00497021
                                     287 *                     E-TEXT (ERR MESG'S) SYSUT4                        00504021
                                     288 *                     COMMON              MAIN-STORAGE                  00511021
                                     289 *                     TABLE: PNUTBL       MAIN-STORAGE (TAMER)          00518021
                                     290 *EXTERNAL ROUTINES:                                                     00525021
                                     291 *        'PH0     '   CALLS THIS PHASE AND PROVIDES I/O, COMMON + T     00532021
                                     292 *                     SUPPORT.                                          00539021
                                     293 *EXITS-NORMAL:  N/A                                                     00546021
                                     294 *EXITS-ERROR:   N/A                                                     00553021
                                     295 *TABLES/WORK AREAS:    ... THOSE ITEMS THAT ARE VARIABLE OR MIXED       00560021
                                     296 *                          CONSTANT-VARIABLE ARE COLLECTED TOGETHER     00567021
                                     297 *                          IN AN AREA UNDER BASE REG XRDATA.            00574021
                                     298 *                      ... THOSE ITEMS THAT ARE NON-INSTRUCTIONS AN     00581021
                                     299 *                          FULLY CONSTANTS ARE COLLECTED UNDER BASE     00588021
                                     300 *                          REG XRCONS.                                  00595021
                                     301 *                                                                       00602021
                                     302 *ATTRIBUTES: NON-REUSABLE (DUE TO SOME NON-INITIALIZED SWITCHES).       00609021
                                     303 *NOTES: N/A                                                             00616021
1         IKFCBL51: PH5CTL - PHASE 51 CONTROL ROUTINE                                                           PAGE    9
-  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                                       ASM 0201 11.03 02/14/15
0                            00000   305        USING   COMON1,XRBAS1                                            00630021
                             00E78   306        USING   COMON3,GBRG1                                             00637021
                             06E30   307        USING   COMON4,XRCONS                                            00644021
                             07B98   308        USING   COMON5,XRDATA                                            00651021
                             00000   309        USING COS,XRBAS2                                                 00658021
                                     310 *                             PH5CTL                                    00665021
                                     311 *******************************************************************     00672021
                                     312 * CHECKS THE INPUT OF PHASE 5 TO DETERMINE WHETHER IT IS A 'STRING'     00679021
                                     313 * OR 'OTHER THAN A STRING'. PUTS 1ST 4 BYTES IN 'HEADER'.               00686021
                                     314 * I. IF THE INPUT IS A 'STRING' -                                       00693021
                                     315 *    A. THE STRING HEADER (A 3 BYTE FIELD) IS STORED IN 'HEADER'.       00700021
                                     316 *       'HEADER+1' IS CALLED 'ANALNO' (ANALYZER NUMBER).                00707021
                                     317 *       'HEADER+2' IS CALLED 'ELEMCT' (ELEMENT COUNT).                  00714021
                                     318 *    B. THE ELEMENTS IN THE STRING ARE PUT IN 'ELEMTB' (ELEMENT TAB     00721021
                                     319 *    C. AFTER ALL ELEMENTS IN A STRING HAVE BEEN STORED IN 'ELEMTB'     00728021
                                     320 *       CONTROL PASSES TO A STRING ANALYZER.                            00735021
                                     321 *    D. AFTER AN ANALYZER HAS PROCESSED THE ELEMENT TABLE CONTROL I     00742021
                                     322 *          RETURNED TO PH5CTL                                           00749021
                                     323 * II. IF THE INPUT IS 'OTHER THAN A STRING' -                           00756021
                                     324 *    A. IF THE INPUT IS A SECTION OR PARAGRAPH NAME IT IS WRITTEN O     00763021
                                     325 *       AND CONTROL IS RETURNED TO 'SEARCH'. (INPUT IS IN 'HEADER')     00770021
                                     326 *    B. IF THE INPUT IS 'EOF' A DUMP IS TAKEN AND PROCESSING IS END     00777021
                                     327 *    C. II(A) AND II(B) WILL BE SPECIFIED IN MORE DETAIL LATER.         00784021
                                     328 *******************************************************************     00791021
                                     329 *******************************************************************     00798021
                                     330 *                                                                       00805021
                                     331 *                                                                       00812021
                                     332 *                                                                       00819021
                                     333 *                                                                       00826021
1         IKFCBL51: PH5CTL - PHASE 51 CONTROL ROUTINE                                                           PAGE   10
-  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                                       ASM 0201 11.03 02/14/15
000000A                              335 PH5CTL   DS    0H                                                       00840021
 00000A 9200 D603      0819B         336          MVI   CDNOSW,XX00                                              00847021
 00000E 45E0 7166      00166         337        BAL   RETRG,GETNXT    *LOCATE NEXT ELEMENT TO BE PROCESSED       00854021
 000012 D200 D5F5 2000 0818D 00000   338          MVC   ASRLAS(LX1),DX0(RW2)    FOR AUTOMATIC STOP RUN           00861021
 000018 9584 2000      00000         339          CLI   DX0(RW2),XX84   TEST IF ELEMENT IS STRING HEADER         00868021
 00001C 4770 700A      0000A         340          BNE   PH5CTL                  RETURN TO CONTROL                00875021

                                     403 *                                                                 7898  01316021
                                     404 *      THIS ROUTINE KEEPS TRACK OF THE GENERATION OF THE START    7898  01323021

                                     409 *                                                                 7898  01358021

                                    1729 *=1      A TEXT GENERATOR                                               10598021
                                    1730 *******************************************************************     10605021
                                    1731 *                                                                       10612021
                                    1732 *        A TEXT GENERATOR                                               10619021
                                    1733 *                                                                       10626021
                                    1734 *******************************************************************     10633021
                                    1735 *        THE A TEXT GENERATOR IS USED BY THE DIFFERENT ANALYZERS        10640021
                                    1736 *                                                                       10647021
                                    1737 *        THERE ARE VARIOUS ENTRY POINTS TO THE A TEXT GENERATOR         10654021
                                    1738 *                                                                       10661021
                                    1739 *        THE ENTRY POINT TO BE USED IS DETERMINED BY THE                10668021
                                    1740 *        OBJECT INSTRUCTION DESIRED                                     10675021
                                    1741 *                                                                       10682021
                                    1742 *        THE LINKAGE TO THE A TEXT GENERATOR IS                         10689021
                                    1743 *           BAL  RETRG,THE PARTICULAR ENTRY POINT                       10696021
                                    1744 *                                                                       10703021
                                    1745 *   THE FOLLOWING WILL DESCRIBE HOW THE WORK AREAS ARE TO BE USED       10710021
                                    1746 *                                                                       10717021
                                    1747 *        XL1 AND XL2 ARE NEEDED FOR SS TYPE INSTRUCTIONS                10724021
                                    1748 *             IF THERE IS ONLY ONE LENGTH PUT IN XL1                    10731021
                                    1749 *                                                                       10738021
                                    1750 *        XWC1 AND XWC2 ARE EACH TWO BYTES LONG                          10745021
                                    1751 *   IF WE ARE IN A BINARY MODE THE LENGTH IS PUT IN A THIRD BYTE        10752021
                                    1752 *                                                                       10759021
                                    1753 *        THE FOLLOWING ELEMENTS EACH HAVE TWO DATA AREAS                10766021
                                    1754 *        XWC,BDISP,TALLY,XGN,XPN,XCON                                   10773021
                                    1755 *             DATA AREA 1 IS USED IF IT IS THE FIRST ADDRESS OPERAN     10780021
                                    1756 *             DATA AREA 2 IS USED IF IT IS THE SECND ADDRESS OPERAN     10787021
                                    1757 *                                                                       10794021
                                    1758 *          FOR DATA NAMES,ALL LITERALS,FIG CONS  POINTERS ARE USED      10801021
                                    1759 *             THE POINTERS ARE PUT IN OP1,OP2 AS THEY ARE NEEDED        10808021
                                    1760 *                                                                       10815021
                                    1761 *******************************************************************     10822021
                                    1762 *******************************************************************     10829021

                                    2771 *                                                                 42646 17892021
                                    2772 * THIS ROUTINE ALLOCATES THREE XSA CELLS FOR USE BY SORT UPON     42646 17899021
                                    2773 * FIRST ENTRY, AND SETS UP THE CELL NUMBERS IN THREE HALFWORDS.   42646 17906021

                                    2779 *                                                                 42646 17948021

1         IKFCBL51: NONNUMERIC COMPARE VERB ANALYZER                                                            PAGE   64
-  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                                       ASM 0201 11.03 02/14/15
0                                   2932 *DEL                                                                    19019021
                                    2933 *DEL                                                                    19026021
 001F48                             2934 IKF50G   CSECT                                                    P6232 19033021
                                    2935 *DEL                                                                    19040021
                                    2936 *DEL                                                                    19047021
                                    2937 *DEL                                                                    19054021
                                    2938 *DEL                                                                    19061021
                                    2939 *                                                                       19068021
                                    2940 *            A SEPERATE ENTRY POINT EXISTS FOR EACH TYPE OF IF...IE     19075021
                                    2941 *      EQ, NOT EQ, LT, NOT LT, GT, NOT GT.                              19082021
                                    2942 *                                                                       19089021
                                    2943 *            AT EACH ENTRY POINT THE ADDRESS OF THE TABLE FOR THAT      19096021
                                    2944 *      TYPE OF COMPARISON IS PUT INTO RW6. THEN CONTROL IS GIVEN TO     19103021
                                    2945 *      THE COMMON IF ANALYZER.                                          19110021
                                    2946 *                                                                       19117021
                                    2947 *            AFTER ANALYSIS OF OPERANDS IS COMPLETE CONTROL IS GIVE     19124021
                                    2948 *      TO IMGEN WHICH GENERATES INSTRUCTIONS FOR BOTH ALPHANUMERIC      19131021
                                    2949 *      MOVE AND IF.                                                     19138021
                                    2950 *                                                                       19145021
                                    2951 *            THERE ARE ALWAYS THREE OPDS SUPPLIED. OPDS 1 AND 2 ARE     19152021
                                    2952 *      THE OPDS TO BE COMPARED. OPD3 IS THE GN TO BE BRANCHED TO IF     19159021
                                    2953 *      THE CONDITION INDICATED BY THE VERB IS MET.                      19166021
                                    2954 *                                                                       19173021
                                    2955 *            P2TEXT      VERB OPD1,OPD2,GN                              19180021
                                    2956 *                                                                       19187021
                                    2957 *                        VERB IS EQ, NEQ, LT, NLT, GT, NGT              19194021
                                    2958 *                                                                       19201021
                                    2959 *                        OPD1 IS A FIGCON, ALPHA LITERAL, GROUP DAT     19208021
                                    2960 *                             OR ALPHA DATA                             19215021
                                    2961 *                                                                       19222021
                                    2962 *                        OPD2 IS AS OPD1                                19229021
                                    2963 *                                                                       19236021
                                    2964 *                                                                       19243021
                                    2965 *            IF OPD1 IS A FIGCON IT IS SWAPPED WITH THE SECOND OPD.     19250021
                                    2966 *            IF OPD1 IS LONGER THAN OPD2 THEN THE OPDS ARE SWAPPED      19257021
                                    2967 *            WHENEVER OPDS ARE SWAPPED THE RELATIONAL IS INVERTED.      19264021
                                    2968 *      IS ACCOMPLISHED BY CHANGING THE ADDR IN RW6. THIS IS DONE BY     19271021
                                    2969 *      LOADING RW6 WITH THE FIRST WORD OF TABLE ADDRESSED AT THAT T     19278021
                                    2970 *      BY RW6. SINCE THE FIRST WORD OF EACH TABLE CONTAINS THE ADDR     19285021
                                    2971 *      OF THE TABLE FOR THE OPPOSITE RELATIONAL THE EFFECT OF INVER     19292021
                                    2972 *      RELATIONALS IS ACCOMPLISHED.                                     19299021
                                    2973 *                                                                       19306021
                                    2974 *            IF THE LENGTH OF OPD2 IS GREATER THAN OPD1 THEN IF THE     19313021
                                    2975 *      FIRST BYTE OF THE TABLE ADDRESSED BY RW6 IS ZERO THE EXCESS      19320021
                                    2976 *      LENGTH OF THE SECOND OPD IS IGNORED. SUCH WOULD BE THE CASE,     19327021
                                    2977 *     FOR EXAMPLE, IF THE INPUT WERE  'GT A,B,GN' WHERE THE LENGTH      19334021
                                    2978 *      B IS GREATER THAN THE LENGTH OF A. IN THE SUBJECT CASE A IS      19341021
                                    2979 *      GREATER THAN B  ONLY IF BY COMPARING THE NUMBER OF BYTES COM     19348021
                                    2980 *      TO BOTH A AND B YIELD A GT B. IF THE RELATION WERE LT THAN T     19355021
                                    2981 *      EXCESS IN B WOULD HAVE TO BE COMPARED IF THE COMPARISON OF T     19362021
                                    2982 *      COMMON BYTES YIELDS AN EQUAL.                                    19369021
                                    2983 *                                                                       19376021
                                    2984 *            THE USE OF THE TABLE IS INDICATED BY THE COMMENTS WITH     19383021
                                    2985 *      DEFINITION OF TABLES.                                            19390021
                                    2986 *DEL                                                                    19397021

                                    3136 *      IT DETERMINES THAT A CHARACTER MOVE IS CALLED FOR.               20447021

                                    3138 *            AFTER ANALYSIS OF THE OPDS CONTROL IS GIVEN TO IMGEN       20461021

                                    3140 *                                                                       20475021
                                    3141 *            THE INPUT ALWAYS CONTAINS TWO OPDS. OPD2 IS ALWAYS A       20482021

00027C8                             3741 IKF50H CSECT                                                            24682021
                                    3742 *                                                                       24689021
                                    3743 *=1    CLASS TEST ANALYZER                                              24696021
                                    3744 *                                                                       24703021
                                    3745 *            A SEPERATE ENTRY POINT EXISTS FOR EACH TYPE OF CLASS T     24710021
                                    3746 *      IE, ALPHA, NOT ALPHA, NUMERIC, NOT NUMERIC.                      24717021
                                    3747 *                                                                       24724021
                                    3748 *    THE ENTRY POINT IS DETERMINED BY THE VALUE OF THE VERB CODE.       24731021
                                    3749 *    THIS CODE MAY APPEAR TO BE DIFFERENT FROM THE VERB USED IN         24738021
                                    3750 *    THE SOURCE STATEMENT.  PHASE4 FLIPS THE VERB EG. NUMERIC BECOM     24745021
                                    3751 *    NOT NUMERIC, IN SIMPLE  'IF'.  IN COMPOUND IF VERBS MAY OR MAY     24752021
                                    3752 *    BE CHANGED BY PHASE4.                                              24759021
                                    3753 *            AT EACH ENTRY POINT THE ADDRESS OF THE TABLE FOR THAT      24766021
                                    3754 *      TYPE OF CLASS TEST IS PUT INTO RW6. THEN CONTROL IS GIVEN TO     24773021
                                    3755 *      THE COMMON CLASS TEST RTN.                                       24780021
                                    3756 *                                                                       24787021
                                    3757 *            THE INPUT ALWAYS HAS TWO OPDS. OPD1 IS A DATA-NAME AND     24794021
                                    3758 *      THE FIELD TO BE TESTED. OPD2 IS THE GN TO TRANSFER TO IF THE     24801021
                                    3759 *      RELATIONAL IS SATISFIED.                                         24808021
                                    3760 *                                                                       24815021
                                    3761 *                                                                       24822021
                                    3762 *NOTE........ALL LABELS ASSOCIATED SOLELY WITH THIS ANALYZER BEGIN      24829021
                                    3763 *            THE CHARACTERS 'CL'.                                       24836021

1         TRANSFORM VERB ANALYZER   T  R  A  N  S  F  O  R  M                                                   PAGE   86
-  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                                       ASM 0201 11.03 02/14/15
0                                   3891 *                                                                       25732021
                                    3892 *                                                                       25739021
                                    3893 *=1    TRANSFORM ANALYZER                                               25746021
                                    3894 *                                                                       25753021
                                    3895 *      THE TRANSFORM ANALYZER IS GIVEN CONTROL BY PH5CTL WHENEVER A     25760021
                                    3896 *      TRANSFORM STRING HAS BEEN ENCOUNTERED.                           25767021
                                    3897 *                                                                       25774021
                                    3898 *            THE INPUT TO THIS ANALYZER CONSISTS OF 4 OPERANDS. THE     25781021
                                    3899 *      FIRST OPERAND IS AN 'INFO' TYPE OPD AND IS NOT USED. THE THI     25788021
                                    3900 *      OPERAND IS THE 'FROM' OPD, THE FOURTH OPD THE 'TO' OPD AND T     25795021
                                    3901 *      SECOND OPD IS THE DATA-NAME TO BE TRANSFORMED.                   25802021
                                    3902 *                                                                       25809021
                                    3903 *            THE GENERATION CONSISTS OF TWO PARTS. PART1 GENERATES      25816021
                                    3904 *      TO SET UP A TRANSLATE TABLE AND PART2  GENERATES CODE TO DO      25823021
                                    3905 *      TRANSLATION.                                                     25830021
                                    3906 *                                                                       25837021
                                    3907 *            THE GENERATION FOR PART1 ALWAY BEGINS WITH                 25844021
                                    3908 *                                                                       25851021
                                    3909 *                   L    2,=V(TRTBL)                                    25858021
                                    3910 *                   MVC  TS2(256),0(2)                                  25865021
                                    3911 *                                                                       25872021
                                    3912 *      'TRTBL' IS AN OBJECT 'SUBROUTINE' WHICH CONSISTS SOLELY OF A     25879021
                                    3913 *      TRANSLATE TABLE WHERE BYTE 0 IS 00, BYTE 1 IS 01, ETC UP TO      25886021
                                    3914 *      BYTE 255 IS FF. TS2 IS A TEMPORARY STORAGE AREA. THE REST OF     25893021
                                    3915 *      THE CODING GENERATED IN PART1 CAUSES THE TRANSLATE TABLE TO      25900021
                                    3916 *      MODIFIED IN THE TS2  AREA AS INDICATED BY OPDS 3 AND 4.          25907021
                                    3917 *      THE REST OF THE CODING GENERATED IN PART 1 DEPENDS ON THE TY     25914021
                                    3918 *      OF OPERANDS THAT OPD2 AND OPD3 ARE                               25921021
                                    3919 *                                                                       25928021
                                    3920 *            1.IF OPD3 IS A 1-BYTE FIGCON OR LTL AND OPD4 IS A DATA     25935021
                                    3921 *                                                                       25942021
                                    3922 *                   MVC  TS2+N(1),OPD4                                  25949021
                                    3923 *                                                                       25956021
                                    3924 *              WHERE N IS THE VALUE OF THE FIGCON OR LTL                25963021
                                    3925 *                                                                       25970021
                                    3926 *            2.IF OPD3 IS A LITERAL NOT GREATER THAN 8 BYTES            25977021
                                    3927 *              AND OPD4 IS A FIGCON OR LTL OF 1 BYTE.                   25984021
                                    3928 *                                                                       25991021
                                    3929 *                   MVI  TS2+N1,X'OPD4'                                 25998021
                                    3930 *                   MVI  TS2+N2,X'OPD4'                                 26005021
                                    3931 *                    .                                                  26012021
                                    3932 *                    .                                                  26019021
                                    3933 *                    .                                                  26026021
                                    3934 *              THAT IS, AN MVI IS GENERATED FOR EACH BYTE OF OPD3.      26033021
                                    3935 *              N1 IS THE VALUE OF THE 1ST BYTE OF THE LITERAL, N2       26040021
                                    3936 *              IS THE VALUE OF THE 2ND BYTE OF THE LITERAL, ETC.        26047021
                                    3937 *                                                                       26054021
                                    3938 *            3. IF OPD3 AND OPD4 ARE LITERALS NOT GREATER THAN 8 BY     26061021
                                    3939 *               BOTH OF EQUAL LENGTH AND GREATER THAN 1 BYTE.           26068021
                                    3940 *                                                                       26075021
                                    3941 *                   MVI  TS2+N1,'OPD4'                                  26082021
                                    3942 *                   MVI  TS2+N2,'OPD4+1'                                26089021
                                    3943 *                    .                                                  26096021
                                    3944 *                    .                                                  26103021
                                    3945 *                    .                                                  26110021
1         TRANSFORM VERB ANALYZER   T  R  A  N  S  F  O  R  M                                                   PAGE   87
-  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                                       ASM 0201 11.03 02/14/15
0                                   3946 *               SEE  COMMENTS FOR =2 ABOVE.                             26117021
                                    3947 *                                                                       26124021
                                    3948 *            4. IF OPD3 IS DATA-NAME GT 1 OR LITERAL GT 8               26131021
                                    3949 *                                                                       26138021
                                    3950 *                   LA   1,LENGTH-OF-OPD3                               26145021
                                    3951 *                   SR   2,2                                            26152021
                                    3952 *                   BALR 3,0                                            26159021
                                    3953 *                   IC   0,OPD4(X)      X= 0 IF OPD4 IS 1 BYTE LONG     26166021
                                    3954 *                   IC   2,OPD3(1)      ' OTHERWISE X = 1               26173021
                                    3955 *                   STC  0,TS2(2)                                       26180021
                                    3956 *                   BCTR 1,0                                            26187021
                                    3957 *                   LTR  1,1                                            26194021
                                    3958 *                   BCR  NOTNEG,3                                       26201021
                                    3959 *                                                                       26208021
                                    3960 *            5. IF OPD3 IS DATA-NAME 1-BYTE LONG                        26215021
                                    3961 *                                                                       26222021
                                    3962 *                   SR   1,1                                            26229021
                                    3963 *                   IC   0,OPD4                                         26236021
                                    3964 *                   IC   1,OPD3                                         26243021
                                    3965 *                   STC  0,TS2(1)                                       26250021
                                    3966 *                                                                       26257021
                                    3967 *            PART 2 OF THE CODING IS VARIABLE DEPENDING ON THE LENG     26264021
                                    3968 *      OF OPD2. IF OPD2 IS NOT VARIABLE LENGTH THEN                     26271021
                                    3969 *                                                                       26278021
                                    3970 *                   TR   OPD2(256),TS2                                  26285021
                                    3971 *                   TR   OPD2+256(256),TS2                              26292021
                                    3972 *                   TR   OPD2+512(256),TS2                              26299021
                                    3973 *                    .                                                  26306021
                                    3974 *                    .                                                  26313021
                                    3975 *                    .                                                  26320021
                                    3976 *                   TR   OPD2+N(LENGTH),TS2                             26327021
                                    3977 *                                                                       26334021
                                    3978 *            WHERE N IS SOME MULTIPLE OF 256 AND LENGTH IS THE          26341021
                                    3979 *            REMAINDER OF THE DIVISION OF THE TOTAL LENGTH BY 256.      26348021
                                    3980 *            OF COURSE, IF THE TOTAL LENGTH IS NOT OT 256 ONLY THE      26355021
                                    3981 *            LAST INSTRUCTION IS GENERATED.                             26362021
                                    3982 *                                                                       26369021
                                    3983 *      IF OPD 2 IS VARIABLE LENGTH THEN                                 26376021
                                    3984 *                                                                       26383021
                                    3985 *                   LA   2,TS2                                          26390021
                                    3986 *                   L    15,=V(TRVL)                                    26397021
                                    3987 *                   BALR 1,15                                           26404021
                                    3988 *                   PARAMETER FOR OPD2                                  26411021
                                    3989 *                                                                       26418021
                                    3990 *                                                                       26425021
                                    3991 *                                                                       26432021
                             02950  3992        USING *,GVERB                                                    26439021

0                                   4160 *=1    ANALYZER FOR EXAMINE                                             27615021
                                    4161 *            THIS ANALYZER GENERATES CODING FOR THE EXAMINE VERB. T     27622021
                                    4162 *            GENERATED CODE VARIES DEPENDING ON THE SOURCE OPIONS       27629021
                                    4163 *            SPECIFIED.                                                 27636021
                                    4164 *                                                                       27643021
                                    4165 *            THE GENERATED CODE IS AS FOLLOWS                           27650021
                                    4166 *                   SR   0,0       ONLY IF TALLY INDICATED              27657021
                                    4167 *                   LA   1,OPD2                                         27664021
                                    4168 *        L     4,=1                                                     27671021
                                    4169 *                   LA   2,LENGTH  ONLY IF FIXED LENGTH                 27678021
                                    4170 *                   LH   2,VLC     ONLY IF VARIABLE LENGTH              27685021
                                    4171 *                   BALR 3,0                                            27692021
                                    4172 *        SR    2,4                                                      27699021
                                    4173 *                   BC   NEG,D3(3) ONLY IF OPD3 NOT NUM, SIGNED         27706021
                                    4174 *                   BC   ZERO,D2(3)ONLY IF OPD3 NUMERIC, SIGNED         27713021
                                    4175 *                   CLI  0(1),CHAR1                                     27720021
                                    4176 *            *      BC   COND,DX(3)                                     27727021
                                    4177 *                   MVC  0(1),CHAR2 ONLY IF REPLACING                   27734021
                                    4178 *                   BCTR 0,0       ONLY IF TALLY INDICATED              27741021
                                    4179 *                   BC   15,DISP3(3) ONLY IF FIRST INDICATED            27748021
                                    4180 *            **     LA   1,1(1)                                         27755021
                                    4181 *                   BCR  15,3                                           27762021
                                    4182 *                                                                       27769021
                                    4183 *            ***    TM   0(1),CHAR1     ONLY IF NUM SIGNED              27776021
                                    4184 *                   BC   NOTONE,D4(3)        DITTO                      27783021
                                    4185 *                   TM   0(1),15-CHAR1       DITTO                      27790021
                                    4186 *            *****  BC   COND,D3(3)          DITTO                      27797021
                                    4187 *            ****** MVN  0(1,1),=X'CHAR2'    DITTO AND REPLACING        27804021
                                    4188 *                   BCTR 0,0                 DITTO AND TALLY INDICA     27811021
                                    4189 *            ****   LCR  0,0            ONLY IF TALLY INDICATED         27818021
                                    4190 *                   ST   0,TALLY        ONLY IF TALLY INDICATED         27825021
                                    4191 *                                                                       27832021
                                    4192 *            *   CONDITION CODE AND DISPLACEMENT VARIES ACCORDING T     27839021
                                    4193 *                   TYPE OF EXAMINE. BEFORE GENERATING ANY INSTRUCT     27846021
                                    4194 *                   THE ANALYZER DETERMINES THE DISPLACEMENTS           27853021
                                    4195 *                   NECESSARY FOR THE BC INSTRUCTIONS TO BE GENERAT     27860021
                                    4196 *                   THE DISPLACEMENT OF THE LA INSTR (MARKED WITH T     27867021
                                    4197 *                   DOUBLE *) IS SAVED IN EXDSP1. THE DISP OF THE R     27874021
                                    4198 *                   TO TEST THE LAST CHAR FOR SIGNED NUM EXAMINES       27881021
                                    4199 *                   (MARKED WITH THE DOUBLE *) IS SAVED IN EXDSP2.      27888021
                                    4200 *                   THE DISPLACEMENT OF THE INSTRUCTION TO BRANCH T     27895021
                                    4201 *                   WHEN THE EXAMINE LOOP IS TO BE TERMINATED IS SA     27902021
                                    4202 *                   IN EXDSP3.                                          27909021
                                    4203 *                                                                       27916021
                                    4204 *                   IF EXAMINE IS FOR UNTIL COND CODE IS 8...OTHERW     27923021
                                    4205 *                   IT IS 7. IF EXAMINE IS FOR ALL OR FIRST DX IS S     27930021
                                    4206 *                   TO EXDSP1. IF FOR UNTIL OR LEADING THE  DX IS S     27937021
                                    4207 *                   TO EXDSP3.                                          27944021
                                    4208 *                   CHAR1 IS AN OPD SPECIFYING CHAR BEING TESTED FO     27951021
                                    4209 *                   CHAR2 IS AN OPD SPECIFYING CHAR FOR REPLACING       27958021
                                    4210 *                   DN IS THE OPD INDICATING THE FIELD TO BE EXAMIN     27965021
                                    4211 *                                                                       27972021
                                    4212 *                   IN THE ILLUSTRATION ABOVE D3 MEANS EXDSP3 AND D     27979021
                                    4213 *                   MEANS EXDSP2.                                       27986021

                                    5714 *      SORT S-F-N ASCENDING KEY-1 DESCENDING KEY-2, INPUT PROCEDURE     38493021

0                                  10790 *                                                                       74025021
                                   10791 *                                                                       74032021
                                   10792 *      TABLES FOR ALPHANUMERIC IF                                       74039021
                                   10793 *                                                                       74046021
                                   10794 *            TABLE FORMAT IS AS FOLLOWS                                 74053021
                                   10795 *             WORD 0                                                    74060021
                                   10796 *                   BYTE 0                                              74067021
                                   10797 *                             BIT 1 IS 1 IF EXTRA LENGTH AFFECTS CO     74074021
                                   10798 *                             BITS 4-7 IS CODE INDICATING RELATIONA     74081021
                                   10799 *                                       1 FOR EQ                        74088021
                                   10800 *                                       2 FOR NOT EQ                    74095021
                                   10801 *                                       3 FOR LT                        74102021
                                   10802 *                                       4 FOR NOT LT                    74109021
                                   10803 *                                       5 FOR GT                        74116021
                                   10804 *                                       6 FOR NOT GT                    74123021
                                   10805 *                   BYTES 1-3  CONTAINS ADDR OF TABLE FOR OPPOSITE      74130021
                                   10806 *                   BYTES 1-3  CONTAIN ADDR OF TABLE FOR OPPOSITE       74137021
                                   10807 *                              RELATIONAL                               74144021
                                   10808 *                                                                       74151021
                                   10809 *             WORDS 1-2  INDICATE BRANCHES TO BE GENERATE FOLLOWING     74158021
                                   10810 *                        COMPARISON. THE FIRST WORD IS USED IF          74165021
                                   10811 *                        COMPARE WAS NOT FOR TRAILING SPACES. THE       74172021
                                   10812 *                        SECOND WORD IS USED IF THE COMPARE WAS FOR     74179021
                                   10813 *                        TRAILING SPACES. WITHIN EACH WORD THE FIRS     74186021
                                   10814 *                        HALF-WORD IS USED IF THERE ARE MORE COMPAR     74193021
                                   10815 *                        TO BE GENERATED (IE, THE AREA BEING COMPAR     74200021
                                   10816 *                        IS GT 256 BYTES AND THE COMPARE JUST GENER     74207021
                                   10817 *                        DOES NOT COMPARE THE LAST PART OF THE AREA     74214021
                                   10818 *                        WITHIN EACH HALF-WORD THE VALUES ARE USED      74221021
                                   10819 *                        FOLLOWS                                        74228021
                                   10820 *                   BYTE 0  IS THE COND CODE TO BE USED IN THE BRAN     74235021
                                   10821 *                           TO THE GN CREATED BY PH5. IF IT IS ZERO     74242021
                                   10822 *                           THE BRANCH IS NOT GENERATED.                74249021
                                   10823 *                   BYTE 1  IS THE COND CODE TO BE USED IN THE BRAN     74256021
                                   10824 *                           TO THE GN WHICH PH4 PASSED TO PH5 IN TH     74263021
                                   10825 *                           VERB STRING. IF IT IS ZERO NO BRANCH IS     74270021
                                   10826 *                           GENERATED.                                  74277021
